isis.stitle: DT/DTA-466 Diesel Engine Service (1990) - FUEL INJECTION PUMP - FUEL INJECTION PUMP - REMOVAL

note.para: Fuel injection pump models mw and PES6A removal and reassembly procedures are similar. Where specific procedures are different, those steps will be detailed.

CLEANLINESS IS OF UTMOST IMPORTANCE WHEN SERVICING FUEL INJECTION SYSTEMS. ALWAYS CLEAN ENGINE BEFORE INJECTION PUMP IS REMOVED OR DISCONNECTING FUEL LINES. ALWAYS PLUG OR CAP ANY OPENING TO PREVENT DIRT, PAINT CHIPS OR OTHER FOREIGN MATERIAL FROM ENTERING THE FUEL SYSTEM. DO NOT CLEAN WITH ENGINE RUNNING.

svcsubproc.para: Set Injection Pump to Engine Timing Prior to Pump Removal as Follows:

step1.para: Disconnect battery cables
Disconnect accelerator cable or linkage from outer injection pump control lever.
Remove injection pump timing pointer plug and gasket from left side of pump mounting adapter.

warning.para: SHUT-OFF MUST BE IN NO-FUEL POSITION BEFORE PROCEEDING.

step1.para: Rotate the engine in the normal operating direction until the engine front cover timing pointer is on the degree mark on the damper pulley for the particular application.

Visually inspect the hub scribe line and timing pointer for alignment. If the scribe line and timing pointer are aligned, the #1 piston is on the compression stroke. Refer to Figure 11.10
.

note.para: The above procedure establishes the accuracy of the previous timing and avoids the necessity of removing the valve cover to establish the #1 compression stroke during reassembly.

step1.para: Verify Injection Pump to Engine Timing as Follows, if Gear Train was Disassembled:
Verify that the #1 piston is on the compression stroke by:

step2.para: Removing the valve cover.
Check to see if the #1 cylinder intake and exhaust valve levers are loose by turning the push rods by hand.
If loose, the #1 piston is on the compression stroke and the injection pump may be removed.
If the #1 cylinder valve levers are NOT loose, set the pump to engine static timing as described in steps 2-3.

step1.para: Rotate the engine one complete revolution. The engine should now be on the #1 compression stroke.

Observe the engine front cover timing pointer and damper pulley degree alignment. To ensure an accurate reading, view the pointer straight on. Refer to Figure 11.10
.

svcsubproc.para: The engine should now be positioned at specified static pump to engine timing. Refer to "SPECIFICATIONS".

note.para: If timing is not within specifications, rotate engine to correct crankshaft position (specified degrees before top dead center) before removing injection pump. If necessary to rotate engine in opposite direction of normal rotation to achieve specified timing, rotate engine to 90 degrees before top dead center and then rotate engine to specified timing. This procedure takes up gear backlash.

figure.caption: Figure 11.10. Injection Pump to Engine Timing (Prior to Pump Removal)(MW Injection Pump Shown).

svcsubproc.title: Remove Fuel Injection Pump
svcsubproc.para: Remove the fuel injection pump as follows:

step1.para:
Using a 6.3 mm (3/4 in.) wrench, loosen the six fuel injection line nuts at the nozzles. Refer to Figure 11.11
.

figure.caption: Figure 11.11. Remove Injection Line Nuts at Nozzles.

step1.para:
(For Engines Equipped with MW Injection Pump) Loosen and remove the fuel injection line nuts at the pump. Refer to Figure 11.12
.

(For Engines Equipped with PES6A Injection Pump) Loosen and remove the fuel injection line nuts at the pump while holding the delivery valve holder with a modified 12 pt. 22 mm (7/8 in.) box wrench to prevent delivery valve movement (which could affect rack travel). Refer to Figure 11.13
.

note.para: The 22 mm (7/8 in.) wrench used to hold the delivery valve must be modified by cutting a slot which allows it to pass over the fuel line. Refer to Figure 11.56 for further description.

step1.para:
Remove the fuel injection lines as an assembly. Refer to Figure 11.14
.

figure.caption: Figure 11.12. Remove Injection Line Nuts at Pump.
Figure 11.13. Remove Injection Line Nuts at Pump.

note.para: CAP ALL FUEL INJECTION LINES, DISCHARGE FITTING AT THE PUMP AND NOZZLE INLETS WITH PLASTIC CAPS. DO NOT USE TAPE. TAPE COLLECTS DIRT AND LEAVES A GUMMY RESIDUE ON MATING SURFACES. REFER TO FIGURES 11.15 THROUGH 11.17.

figure.caption: Figure 11.16. Cap Pump Discharge Fitting (Model MW Injection Pump Shown).

step1.para:
Remove the aneroid tube as follows: (Refer to Figure 11.18
). (Engine Model D185F and Model D210F(w/Injection Pump 1 813 987 C91) are not equipped with an aneroid.)

step2.para: Remove the connecting nuts at the pump aneroid and at the intake manifold.
Remove the rubber sealing sleeves at each end and discard.
Cap the openings at the aneroid and the intake manifold.

step1.para:
(For MW Injection Pump) Remove the final filter to injection pump hose as follows: (Refer to Figure 11.19
).

step2.para: Remove hose from filter header elbow.

Loosen and remove fuel hose clamp from injection pump adapter ( Figure 11.20
).

note.para: Hose may be left mounted to injection pump elbow and removed after pump removal.

step2.para: Cap the fuel filter header elbow and injection pump elbow (if removed).

step1.para:
(For MW Injection Pump) Remove the primary fuel filter to supply pump tube as follows: (Refer to Figure 11.20
).

step2.para: Loosen and remove the nuts at the fuel filter header and supply pump elbows. Remove and discard the sealing sleeves from the inlet tube.
Cap the fuel filter header and supply pump openings.

note.para: Early style engines were equipped with a fuel inlet hose and flared elbows.

step1.para:
(For MW Injection Pump) Remove the supply pump to final filter tube as follows: (Refer to Figure 11.20
).

step2.para: Loosen and remove nuts at the fuel filter header and supply pump elbows. Remove and discard sealing sleeves from the tube.
Cap the fuel filter header and supply pump openings.

figure.caption: Figure 11.19. Remove Final Filter/Injection Pump Hose.
Figure 11.20. MW Injection Pump Fuel Supply Lines.

step1.para:
(For PES6A Injection Pump) Remove the final filter to injection pump hose as follows: (Refer to Figure 11.21
).

step2.para: Loosen and remove hose from filter header elbow.
Loosen and remove the hollow screw, bleed screw and copper sealing gaskets at the injection pump banjo fitting.
Cap the fuel filter header elbow and the injection pump inlet.

step1.para:
(For PES6A Injection Pump) Remove the primary fuel filter to supply pump (pump inlet) tube as follows: (Refer to Figure 11.21
).

step2.para: Loosen and remove the nut at the fuel filter header elbow. Remove and discard the sealing sleeve from the inlet tube.
Loosen and remove the hollow screw and copper sealing gaskets at the supply pump banjo fitting.
Cap the fuel filter header and supply pump openings.

step1.para:
(For PES6A Injection Pump) Remove the supply pump to final filter (pump outlet) tube as follows: (Refer to Figure 11.21
).

step2.para: Loosen and remove the nut at the fuel filter header elbow. Remove and discard the sealing sleeve from the inlet tube.
Loosen and remove the hollow screw and copper sealing gaskets at the supply pump banjo fitting.
Cap the fuel filter header and supply pump openings.

figure.caption: Figure 11.21. PES6A Injection Pump Fuel Supply Lines.

step1.para:
Remove the upper and lower throttle return springs. Refer to Figure 11.22
.

note.para: The lower spring has a small diameter while the upper spring has a larger diameter.

step1.para:
(For MW Injection Pump) Disconnect the fuel return line as follows: Refer to Figure 11.23
.

step2.para: Remove the intake manifold stud nut (at the #4 cylinder position).

note.para: The nut retains washers, clamps and spacer.

step2.para: Loosen and remove the fuel return hose from the fuel return tube.
Cap the fuel return tube and hose.

step1.para:
(For PES6A Injection Pump) Disconnect the fuel return line as follows: Refer to Figure 11.4
.

step2.para: Loosen and remove the hollow screw (28) and copper sealing gaskets at the injection pump banjo fitting.

note.para: Remove hose clamp (12) and clip (2) to remove fuel return hose (25), if required.
